# Developer Onboarding Guide

## Welcome to the Team!

This guide will help you get up to speed quickly.

## Week 1: Environment Setup

### Day 1
- [ ] Complete HR paperwork
- [ ] Receive hardware (laptop, monitors, peripherals)
- [ ] Set up accounts (email, Slack, GitHub, JIRA)
- [ ] Install development tools
- [ ] Clone main repositories
- [ ] Run local development environment

### Day 2-3
- [ ] Read architecture documentation
- [ ] Review coding standards
- [ ] Watch team workflow videos
- [ ] Attend team standup
- [ ] Pair with senior developer

### Day 4-5
- [ ] Pick up first starter task
- [ ] Submit first pull request
- [ ] Get code review feedback
- [ ] Deploy to staging environment

## Week 2: Product Familiarization

- Learn product features
- Understand user workflows
- Review product roadmap
- Meet with product manager
- Customer support shadowing

## Team Resources

### Communication
- **Slack**: Primary communication tool
  - #engineering: Technical discussions
  - #team-updates: Announcements
  - #help: Ask questions
- **Email**: Official communications only
- **Meetings**: Calendar invites

### Development Workflow
1. Pick task from JIRA
2. Create feature branch
3. Implement + write tests
4. Submit PR for review
5. Address feedback
6. Merge to main
7. Deploy to production

### Team Conventions
- Daily standup: 9:30 AM
- Sprint planning: Every other Monday
- Retrospective: Every other Friday
- Code freeze: Thursday 5 PM
- Deploy window: Friday 2-4 PM

## Key Contacts

- **Engineering Manager**: Jane Doe (jane@company.com)
- **Tech Lead**: John Smith (john@company.com)
- **DevOps**: DevOps team (devops@company.com)
- **HR**: hr@company.com

## Resources

- Architecture docs: `/docs/architecture/`
- API documentation: `https://api-docs.company.com`
- Design system: `https://design.company.com`
- Team handbook: `https://handbook.company.com`

## First Month Goals

By end of month 1, you should:
- [ ] Complete 5+ pull requests
- [ ] Deploy 3+ features to production
- [ ] Participate in code reviews
- [ ] Understand team workflows
- [ ] Know key system components

## Questions?

Don't hesitate to ask! We're here to help. Use #help Slack channel or ping your team lead.
